item.title: Object storage with OpenShift Container Storage
item.description: OpenShift Container Storage (OCS) from Red Hat deploys Ceph in your OpenShift cluster (or allows you to integrate with an external Ceph cluster). In addition to the file- and block- based volume services provided by Ceph, OCS includes two S3-api compatible object storage implementations. The first option is the Ceph Object Gateway (radosgw), Ceph’s native object storage interface. The second option called the “Multicloud Object Gateway”, which is in fact a piece of software named Noobaa, a storage abstraction layer that was acquired by Red Hat in 2018.
